questions.question: The Industrial Revolution BEGAN in which country?
What is the BEST description of the Industrial Revolution?

choices.answer: time when wars began as countries searched for raw materials
time when production of goods was increased by machines
time when all of Europe went to war with each other
time when people fought for more freedoms

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT one of the factors necessary for a country to become “industrialized”?
The use of machines to increase the speed of production BEGAN in which industry?
Which 2 raw materials became the MOST important during the Industrial Revolution?
Which of the following does NOT describe the “Factory System” which came to be used during the Industrial Revolution?

choices.answer: work was done in the home
work was done by large numbers of people in a building
a supervisor made sure workers were on task
machines were used to speed up production

questions.question: Why were early factories built near rivers?

choices.answer: they could be used as a water source in case a fire started
they provided a power source for the early machines in the factories
they provided drinking water for the many workers
they could be used to keep the factory clean and sanitary

questions.question: Factories usually hired women and children because they were easily trained and?
The “Factory Act of 1833” limited the workday to 10 hours in Great Britain.  This is an example of

choices.answer: the workers desiring to work harder so that they can make more money
the government trying to pass laws to make life better for factory workers
the factory owners working to improve working conditions for their workers
rich people trying stop workers from making more money

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT true for factory workers in the early part of the Industrial Revolution?

choices.answer: they only got 4 weeks of vacation time per year
they were not compensated if they were injured on the job

questions.question: Division of labor (Assembly line) in a factory means that each worker performs _____ of the process.
.What was the main cause of “urbanization” that occurred in 19th century England and elsewhere in Europe?

choices.answer: poor crop yields in the country

questions.question: The term “laissez faire” refers to the economic policy of

choices.answer: letting owners of business set working conditions without government help
demanding all industry and business be government-owned and operated
allowing for strong government involvement in the setting of workplace
requiring that owners of business not set any working conditions

questions.question: A group of workers who join together to demand better pay and working conditions are known as a:
One way groups of workers could fights factory owners for better working conditions was to refuse to work.  What is this
Capitalism means that businesses are owned by _______.
Socialists believe that ______ should own and operate the businesses in a country.
Which of the following is NOT a belief of Socialists?

choices.answer: the government should control the “means of production”
the government should promote economic equality among the people
there should be no private property
private owners should be allowed to compete with one another

questions.question: What man is considered to be the father of “Communism”?
How were companies able to raise the necessary money to purchase new machines?

choices.answer: shares were sold to investors by corporations to raise the money needed
they were NOT able to afford them – the government owned all the machines
businessmen waited long periods of time until the price declined
only super wealthy businessmen were able to purchase the machines

questions.question: How did the Industrial Revolution affect cities?

choices.answer: it created technology to clean them
it made the population grow faster than the housing supply
it made them lose valuable sources of food
it made the crime rate drop

questions.question: Which of the following did NOT occur during the early part of the Industrial Revolution?

choices.answer: it improved living conditions in cities
it increased the production of goods

questions.question: How did the “Factory System” change that way people lived?

choices.answer: people now grew their own food to eat
goods were made mostly by hand
workers could now set their own work hours

questions.question: Industrialization spread because ?

choices.answer: other nations wanted to have the same economic opportunities
Britain shared the new technology in order to gain new trading partners
Parliament relaxed Britain's monopoly on industrial technology
Britain had to trade its technology for labor and natural resources

questions.question: What important contribution did James Watt make to the Industrial Revolution?

choices.answer: He developed a seed drill for planting.
He developed ways to increase crop yields.
He perfected a new source of energy.
He improved methods of iron smelting.
